definitions.body: sister (Ph. [[אחת]], Aram. [[אֲחָת]] h.yoto0, Ar. 0’uxtun, As. aḫâtu, Dl:w, Eth. 0xt: Sab. in n.pr. [[אחַתאמהו]] Os:ZMG 1865, 273)—abs. ´[[אָ]] 2Sa 13:1 + (never with art.); cstr. [[אֲחוֹת]] Ge 4:22 +; sf. [[אֲחׂתִי]] ([[אֲחוֹתִי]]) Ge 12:13 +, etc.; pl. sf. [[אַחְוֹתַי]] (Qr [[אַחְיוֹתַי]]) Jos 2:13; [[אֲחוֹתַיִח]] Ez Eze 16:51 (Qr; Kt [[אחותך]]) + 2 t. (Co all ´[[אחיו]]); [[אַחֲיוֹתֵח]] Ez Eze 16:52 (Co [[־תיך]]); [[אֲחוֹתֵח]] Ez Eze 16:52 (must be pl., but del. Co); [[אַחְיׁתָיו]] Job 42:11; [[אֲחוֹתֵיכֶם]] Ho 2:3; [[אַחְיׁתֵיהֶם]] 1Ch 2:16 Job 1:4—

sister Ge 4:22, Ge 12:13, Ge 12:19, Ge 20:2, Ge 20:5, Ge 20:12 (same father, diff. mother) so Le 18:11 cf. Ez Eze 22:11; Ge 24:30, Ge 24:30 +, Ex 2:4, Ex 2:7; Le 18:9 (either parent same) so De 27:22, Nu 6:7, 2Sa 13:1, 2Sa 13:2, 2Sa 13:4 +, Ct So 8:8, So 8:8, called upon, in mourning for dead Je 22:18; = near relative Ge 24:59, Ge 24:60 (or because Laban prominent ? so Di); /man of same nationality Nu 25:18 cf. Ho 2:3.
= beloved Ct So 4:9, So 4:10, So 4:12, So 5:12 (4 t. ‖[[כַּלָּה]]  bride; phr. orig. im-plying that marriage with half-sister—of same father—was allowed? cf. Nö:ZMG 1886, 150 & Ge 20:12).
symbol. of Judah, Samaria, Sodom & Jerusalem Je 3:7, Je 3:8; Je 3:10, Ez Eze 16:45, Eze 16:52, Eze 16:52 (del. Co) +, Eze 23:4, Eze 23:11 +.
fig. of intimate connection [[אִמִּי וַאֲחׂתִי לָרִמָּה]]…[[קָרָאתִי ]] Job 17:14; [[אֱמׂר לַחָכְמָה]] [[אֲחׂתִי אַתְּ]] Pr 7:4. †

. another, [[אִשָּׁה אֶל־אֲחׂתָהּ]], of curtains of tabern. Ex 26:3, Ex 26:3, Ex 26:6, loops v:Ex 26:5, tenons v:Ex 26:17; of wings of living creatures, Ezek.'s vision Ez Eze 1:9, Eze 1:23, Eze 3:13; not of persons, but vid. [[רְעוּת]].
